summary: This document appears to be an internal email chain from August 12, 2019, among staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, discussing the aftermath of an incident (likely Jeffrey Epstein's death) and the need to support staff, maintain unity, and avoid media contact. It references the impending arrival of the 'RD and his entourage'.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of internal emails at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, discussing staff welfare and operational matters following an incident.

events.title: Internal MCC Communications After Incident
events.description: Email correspondence among MCC New York staff discussing the well-being of staff, the importance of sticking together and not talking to the media, and preparing for the arrival of the 'RD and his entourage'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The communication is dated August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his MCC New York cell.
Staff are instructed to stick together and avoid discussing anything with the media.
The 'RD and his entourage' are expected to arrive, likely referring to the Regional Director or another official for an investigation or review.
The tone emphasizes checking on staff, particularly first responders, and maintaining positivity.
The document is internal operational correspondence from within the federal prison system following a major incident.
